data.text:
Protocol Chronicles: 124 80 years of the Republic of Iceland- Icelandic National Day Iceland was part of Norway and then was ruled by Denmark for more than 500 years, but the country became an independent republic on 17th June 1944. Iceland Europe‚Äôs westernmost country is located between the Greenland Sea and the North Atlantic Ocean. Being a nation of roughly 340,000 people, Iceland exhibits a close-knitted sense of community. Icelanders take great pride in trying their best to progress human rights and values. The nation ranks amongst the most evolved in the world when it comes to gender equality, freedom of expression, and levels of democracy. The country proudly boasts Europe‚Äôs most powerful waterfall Dettifoss; largest bird cliff L√°trabjarg; and glacier Vatnaj√∂kull. A volcanic island, Iceland contains about 200 volcanoes and has one-third of Earth‚Äôs total lava flow. Be it the purest water in the world, cascading in beautiful waterfalls, the summers of the midnight sun, the winters and their Northern Lights, or the landscapes of continental fissure zones ,the island has such a diverse array of natural wonders that anyone can‚Äôt help but fall in love. It is astonishing to know that the country has produced many successful trail blazing musicians. Be it the elvish melodies of Sigur R√≥s, the hypnotising beats of Gusgus, or the indie charms of Of Monsters and Men, Icelanders continue to amaze the world‚Äôs population with their incredible talents when it comes to the creation of sound. Congratulations to this fabulous country and Icelanders for completing 80 years as nation . To celebrate the achievements of this glorious nation Mr. Gul Kripalani ,Honorary Consul of Iceland in Mumbai and his gracious wife Sheela hosted wonderful reception in the presence of Ambassador H.E. Gudni Bragason. üáÆüá≥üáÆüá∏ üìçBlue Sea, Worli 3.7.24 #iceland #reykjavik #consulate

Protocol Chronicles 123 Quebec National Day- Saint Jean Baptiste Day..... Quebec is one of the provinces of Canada.The majority of Quebec's population speaks French as their first language, which sets the province apart from the rest of Canada. The language difference has also led to cultural differences between Quebec and the rest of Canada. Quebec has a distinct cultural identity that is influenced by its French roots. Quebec National Day, i.e. Saint-Jean-Baptiste Day iscelebrated worldwide on June 24, especially in Canada and the United States, mainly a celebration of francophone culture , filled with public events, parades, barbecues, picnics and fireworks. The National day holiday is a way to celebrate the heritage and contributions of francophones to the world's culture. The province of Quebec is gorgeous! With centuries of history, stunning landscapes and beautiful coastlines, it's one of Canada's most-gorgeous places. Quebec is well known for producing maple syrup, for its comedy, and for making hockey as one of the most popular sports in Canada. It is also renowned for its culture, literature, music, films, TV shows, festivals, folklore. Quebec has wonderful connect with Maharashtra, Mumbai.The Qu√©bec Government Office in Mumbai exercises a mandate of promotion of trade, investment and cooperation in the fields of education and research, science and technology. Very learned Francis Paradis who is into management and governance for many years has been Director of the Qu√©bec Government Office in Mumbai . And i must mention that this office is very helpful and advises, assists Qu√©bec companies seeking business opportunities in India. Maharashtra government and Quebec government have signed a memorandum of understanding to increase economic cooperation, specially in areas like information technology, biotechnology, artificial intelligence and welfare of the tribal community. Cooperation agreement that Quebec signed with Maharshtra is going strong with exchanges with IIT, Mumbai; Tata Institute of Fundamental Research, SNDT University, Prince Aly Khan hospital. This is due to the research and development that Quebec is known for at international level. It is a matter of pride that some Quebec companies have subsidiaries or local distributors in Maharashtra. The Quebec bureau completes 16 years of existence in Maharashtra which is highly creditable. I congratulate and extend my best wishes to all quebec friends for Quebec National Day- Saint Jean Baptiste Day. üáÆüá≥üá≤üá∂ üìç Gallary North, Four Seasons, Worli. 20.6.24 #Quebec #canada #quebeccity #montreal #ConsulGeneral #ottawa #mumbai

Protocol Chronicles 122 SAVOUR SRI LANKA It was an invitation by Consul General of Srilanka Dr. Valson Vethody to indulge our senses in a culinary journey to the tropical paradise of Sri Lanka at Fairfield by Marriott Mumbai‚Äôs Sri Lankan Food Festival, where the vibrant and aromatic flavors of Sri Lankan cuisine were at centre stage. Super Chefs Dilan Almeida and Ruchira Naveen came all the way from the renowned Courtyard by Marriott in Sri Lanka! With expertise honed in the kitchens of Colombo, this culinary maestro showcased the best of Sri Lankan gastronomy, straight to our plates. Diplomats of many nations, government officials, businessmen and all the other invited Srilankan friends embarked on a gastronomic adventure as these chefs crafted an exquisite array of Sri Lankan delicacies. From fragrant rice dishes infused with spices to succulent seafood curries bursting with flavor, every bite transported us to the sun-kissed shores of Sri Lanka. This Festival also featured traditional dance performance by Rivega dance Studio from Sri Lanka. Here are some of Srilankan delicacies that were included in menu of food festival ‚Ä¶. Ceylon Flavoured Drumstick Soup, Kohila & Umbalakada, Pol Roti Square, Isso wade,Jaffna Crab Curry, Negombo Chili Garlic Lagoon Prawn, Aluwa Peni walalu. üìç Mado Mado, Fairfield By Marriott, 16.6.24 #srilanka #srilankatravel #srilankatourism #colombo #srilankatourism #srilankafoodfestival #srilankafood #srilankafoodfestival2024 #ConsulateGeneralOfIndia #ConsulateGeneral #Consulate #embassy

Protocol Chronicles:121 Day of Russia June 12 is called the birthday of modern Russia. On June 12, 1990 the first Congress of Peoples‚Äô Deputies of the RSFSR adopted the Declaration on State Sovereignty of Russia. It proclaimed the supremacy of the Constitution of the Russian Federation and its laws all over the country. Therefore, June 12 is considered the starting point of the modern history of the state. Russia has a lot to be proud with. Its territory is the largest in the world, occupying around 40% of Europe and almost whole northern part of Asia. Russian science and education system are well-known and respected globally. Russian explorers discovered more than 1/6 part of the world territory, including Arctic and Antarctic, cosmonaut Yury Gagarin was the first man in outer space. Russian culture, diverse and expressive, has always been an inherent and essential part of the world‚Äôs cultural heritage. Poems and novels by Pushkin, Tolstoy, Dostoevsky and others are translated into many languages and loved by international readers. Music by Tchaikovsky, Prokofiev, Shostakovich is a must at classical music concert. And Russian ballet has already become a ‚Äúspecial feature‚Äù of country‚Äôs heritage. India Russia relationship, friendship is amongst the most steady international relationships in the world. India Russia have wonderful bilateral ties in military, economy, trade & commerce, science & technology, and culture too. Both countries closely collaborate on matters of national interest at United Nations, BRICS, G20 and SCO. India has a great Bollywood connection with Russia and Russia too had a love affair with Indian films for very long. Since Bollywood super star legend Rajkapoor to very recent Allu Arjun 'Pushpa- The rise' India made remarkable Bollywood presence in Russia. It was great pleasure to attend wonderful reception hosted by Consul General of the Russian Federation Mr. Aleksei Surovtsev & his gracious wife Mrs. Zhanna Surovtseva to celebrate Day of Russia in Mumbai. On the occasion of this auspicious day I extend my best wishes to all Russia friends. üáÆüá≥üá∑üá∫ üìçRegal Room, Trident Hotel, Nariman Point 6.6.24 #russia #stpetersburg #moscow #IndoRussiaTradeChamber #IndoRussiaFriends #RussianConsulateinMumbai #ConsulGeneralsinMumbai #Bollywood #foreignmissions #embassy #russi
